# Day 1277

I've been going ham on an article for liquidity tonight and I don't want to share it here as I already shared the draft a couple of days ago. I'm tired though from rewriting and reworking the same essay over and over again.

![GOOD](https://miro.medium.com/1*6-dCzvMVAAcFnWTpWP8PyQ.png)

Greatness requires sacrifice. Want something done right? Do it yourself, over and over again until you get it right. Simple as.

I will share seven insights from the essay with some humor added in because unless you enjoy studying monetary theory like I do these ideas can be a bit dry. So hope you get some alpha from this anon and you don't have to read 1.5k words either to get the idea:

- **Politicians are addicted to debt like college kids to ramen.** The fiat system structurally requires ever-expanding credit; "fiscal responsibility" is political suicide.

- **Fiat money is a Ponzi scheme with better branding.** New money comes in as credit, but the interest isn't created - meaning the system must keep inflating just to stand still.

- **Liquidity is the invisible tide, and Bitcoin surfs it best.** When central banks flood markets with money, Bitcoin rockets; when they drain it, Bitcoin wipes out - but it always gets back on the board.

- **Responsible government is Bitcoin's kryptonite.** If politicians suddenly balanced budgets and lived within their means, Bitcoin would be in trouble - but that's about as likely as Congress skipping a pay raise.

- **The Fed is juggling grenades with oven mitts.** Price stability, jobs, and keeping the Treasury market alive can't all coexist - so they keep printing and hoping the music doesn't stop.

- **Bitcoin flips the script: twelve words > twelve guns.** Instead of violence and coercion backing money, Bitcoin uses encryption and scarcity, letting anyone carry wealth across borders in their head.

- **The trade is simple: unlimited fiat claims vs. 21 million Bitcoin.** Politicians will always choose the printing press over pain, and as long as that Ponzi keeps running, being long Bitcoin is one of the most logical bets on Earth.

9/19/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
